expl: she made frequent mention of her promotion
there was no mention of it
the speaker made several references to his wife
mention.n.01.defn: a remark that calls attention to something or someone

expl: the student's essay failed to list several important citations
the acknowledgments are usually printed at the front of a book
the article includes mention of similar clinical cases
citation.n.03.defn: a short note recognizing a source of information or of a quoted passage

expl: it is used as a reference for comparing the heating and the electrical energy involved
reference_point.n.01.defn: an indicator that orients you generally

expl: he contributed articles to the basic reference work on that topic
reference_book.n.01.defn: a book to which you can refer for authoritative facts

expl: requests for character references are all too often answered evasively
character.n.07.defn: a formal recommendation by a former employer to a potential future employer describing the person's qualifications and dependability

expl: the extension of `satellite of Mars' is the set containing only Demos and Phobos
reference.n.06.defn: the most direct or specific meaning of a word or expression; the class of objects that an expression refers to

expl: reference to an encyclopedia produced the answer
reference.n.07.defn: the act of referring or consulting

expl: he carried an armful of references back to his desk
he spent hours looking for the source of that quotation
reference.n.08.defn: a publication (or a passage from a publication) that is referred to

address.n.01.defn: (computer science) the code that identifies where a piece of information is stored

expl: he argued that reference is a consequence of conditioned reflexes
reference.n.10.defn: the relation between a word or phrase and the object or idea it refers to

expl: his no was loud and clear

nobelium.n.01.defn: a radioactive transuranic element synthesized by bombarding curium with carbon ions; 7 isotopes are known
